corrected_solution:
On Sunday he takes 2 hours to get there because 4 / 2 = 2
This takes him 120 minutes because 2 x 60 = 120
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him .4 hours to get to the store because 4 / 10 = .4
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him 24 minutes to get to the store because .4 x 60 = 24
In total it takes him 168 minutes to get to the store because 120 + 24 + 24 = 168
On average it takes him 56 minutes because 168 / 3 = 56
#### 56
corrected_explanation: Step 5 first makes a mistake in the calculation process, calculating 120+24+24=138 instead of 120+24+24=168. The subsequent step 6 references the result of step 5, calculating 138/3=46 instead of 168/3=56, resulting in the final incorrect answer.

corrected_solution:
On Sunday he takes 2 hours to get there because 4 / 2 = 2
This takes him 120 minutes because 2 x 60 = 120
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him .4 hours to get to the store because 4 / 10 = .4
On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him 24 minutes to get to the store because .4 x 60 = 24
In total it takes him 168 minutes to get to the store because 120 + 24 + 24 = 168
On average it takes him 56 minutes because 168 / 3 = 56
#### 56
corrected_explanation: Step 2 first makes a mistake in unit conversion and mistakenly believes that one hour has 50 minutes instead of 60 minutes, calculating 2 x 50 = 100 instead of 2 x 60 = 120. The subsequent step 5 reference the result of step 2, calculating 100 + 24 + 24 = 148 instead of 120 + 24 + 24 = 168. The subsequent step 6 reference the result of step 5, calculating 148 / 3 = 49.3 instead of 168 / 3 = 56, resulting in the final incorrect answer.
